informal_statement: Let $a_0 = 1$. For any positive integer $n$, let $a_{n+1} = \prod_{k = 1}^n a_k + 4$. Show that for any positive integer $n$, $a_n - \sqrt{a_{n+1}} = 2$.
formal_statement:
theorem numbertheory_aneqprodakp4_anmsqrtanp1eq2:
  fixes a :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "a 0 = 1"
    and h1 : "\<And>n. a (n+1) = (\<Prod>(k::nat) =1..n. (a k))+4"
  shows "\<And>n. (n\<ge>1) \<Longrightarrow> a n - sqrt (a (n+1)) = 2"
